query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Forse semilia miglia di lontano 2 ci ferve l’ora sesta, e questo mondo 3 china già l’ombra quasi al letto piano,
query.result: 1 Perhaps a thousand miles away, 2 the sixth hour boils for us, and this world 3 already bends its shadow almost to the level bed,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 quando ’l mezzo del cielo, a noi profondo, 5 comincia a farsi tal, ch’alcuna stella 6 perde il parere infino a questo fondo;

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 e come vien la chiarissima ancella 8 del sol più oltre, così ’l ciel si chiude 9 di vista in vista infino a la più bella.
query.result: 7 and as the very bright handmaid 8 of the sun comes further, so the sky closes 9 from sight to sight up to the most beautiful one.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Non altrimenti il trïunfo che lude 11 sempre dintorno al punto che mi vinse, 12 parendo inchiuso da quel ch’elli ’nchiude,
query.result: 10 Not otherwise the triumph that plays 11 always around the point that conquered me, 12 seeming enclosed by that which it encloses,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 a poco a poco al mio veder si stinse: 14 per che tornar con li occhi a Bëatrice 15 nulla vedere e amor mi costrinse.
query.result: 13 little by little faded from my sight: 14 so that nothing seeing and love constrained me 15 to return with my eyes to Beatrice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Se quanto infino a qui di lei si dice 17 fosse conchiuso tutto in una loda, 18 poca sarebbe a fornir questa vice.
query.result: 16 If all that is said of her up to here 17 were concluded all in one praise, 18 it would be little to furnish this turn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 La bellezza ch’io vidi si trasmoda 20 non pur di là da noi, ma certo io credo 21 che solo il suo fattor tutta la goda.
query.result: 19 The beauty that I saw transcends 20 not only beyond us, but I believe for sure 21 that only its maker enjoys it fully.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Da questo passo vinto mi concedo 23 più che già mai da punto di suo tema 24 soprato fosse comico o tragedo:
query.result: 22 Overcome by this passage, I yield 23 more than ever before by a point of his theme 24 was ever comic or tragedian:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 ché, come sole in viso che più trema, 26 così lo rimembrar del dolce riso 27 la mente mia da me medesmo scema.
query.result: 25 for, like the sun in the face that trembles more, 26 so the remembrance of the sweet smile 27 deprives my mind of myself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Dal primo giorno ch’i’ vidi il suo viso 29 in questa vita, infino a questa vista, 30 non m’è il seguire al mio cantar preciso;

Please translate each line literally into English.
31 ma or convien che mio seguir desista 32 più dietro a sua bellezza, poetando, 33 come a l’ultimo suo ciascuno artista.
query.result: 31 but now it is necessary that my following desist 32 any further after her beauty, in my poetry, 33 as every artist does with his last work.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Cotal qual io lascio a maggior bando 35 che quel de la mia tuba, che deduce 36 l’ardüa sua matera terminando,
query.result: 34 Such as I leave her to a greater heralding 35 than that of my trumpet, which concludes 36 its arduous subject matter, coming to an end,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 con atto e voce di spedito duce 38 ricominciò: «Noi siamo usciti fore 39 del maggior corpo al ciel ch’è pura luce:
query.result: 37 with the bearing and voice of an unhurried leader 38 she began again: "We have come forth 39 from the greatest body to the heaven that is pure light:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Qui vederai l’una e l’altra milizia 44 di paradiso, e l’una in quelli aspetti 45 che tu vedrai a l’ultima giustizia».
query.result: 43 Here you will see both the one and the other host 44 of paradise, and the one in those aspects 45 that you will see at the final judgment."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Come sùbito lampo che discetti 47 li spiriti visivi, sì che priva 48 da l’atto l’occhio di più forti obietti,
query.result: 46 Like a sudden flash of lightning that scatters 47 the visual spirits, so that it deprives 48 the eye of stronger objects from its act,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 così mi circunfulse luce viva, 50 e lasciommi fasciato di tal velo 51 del suo fulgor, che nulla m’appariva.
query.result: 49 so a living light flashed all around me, 50 and left me swathed in such a veil 51 of its radiance that nothing appeared to me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 «Sempre l’amor che queta questo cielo 53 accoglie in sé con sì fatta salute, 54 per far disposto a sua fiamma il candelo».
query.result: 52 "The love that quiets this heaven 53 always receives into itself with such salvation, 54 to make the candle ready for its flame."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Non fur più tosto dentro a me venute 56 queste parole brievi, ch’io compresi 57 me sormontar di sopr’ a mia virtute;

Please translate each line literally into English.
58 e di novella vista mi raccesi 59 tale, che nulla luce è tanto mera, 60 che li occhi miei non si fosser difesi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
61 e vidi lume in forma di rivera 62 fulvido di fulgore, intra due rive 63 dipinte di mirabil primavera.
query.result: 61 and I saw a light in the form of a river 62 glowing with splendor, between two banks 63 painted with a marvelous springtime.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Di tal fiumana uscian faville vive, 65 e d’ogne parte si mettien ne’ fiori, 66 quasi rubin che oro circunscrive;

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 poi, come inebrïate da li odori, 68 riprofondavan sé nel miro gurge, 69 e s’una intrava, un’altra n’uscia fori.
query.result: 67 then, as if intoxicated by the fragrances, 68 they plunged themselves back into the wondrous whirlpool, 69 and if one entered, another issued forth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 «L’alto disio che mo t’infiamma e urge, 71 d’aver notizia di ciò che tu vei, 72 tanto mi piace più quanto più turge;

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 ma di quest’ acqua convien che tu bei 74 prima che tanta sete in te si sazi»: 75 così mi disse il sol de li occhi miei.
query.result: 73 but it is necessary that you drink of this water 74 before such thirst in you is sated": 75 thus the sun of my eyes spoke to me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Anche soggiunse: «Il fiume e li topazi 77 ch’entrano ed escono e ’l rider de l’erbe 78 son di lor vero umbriferi prefazi.
query.result: 76 He also added: "The river and the topazes 77 that enter and leave and the laughter of the grasses 78 are shadowy prefaces of their true forms.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Non che da sé sian queste cose acerbe; 80 ma è difetto da la parte tua, 81 che non hai viste ancor tanto superbe».

Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Non è fantin che sì sùbito rua 83 col volto verso il latte, se si svegli 84 molto tardato da l’usanza sua,
query.result: 82 There is no infant who rushes so suddenly 83 with his face toward the milk, if he awakens 84 much later than his usual time,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 come fec’ io, per far migliori spegli 86 ancor de li occhi, chinandomi a l’onda 87 che si deriva perché vi s’immegli;

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 e sì come di lei bevve la gronda 89 de le palpebre mie, così mi parve 90 di sua lunghezza divenuta tonda.
query.result: 88 and just as the eaves of my eyelids drank of it, 89 so it seemed to me that its length 90 had become round.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Poi, come gente stata sotto larve, 92 che pare altro che prima, se si sveste 93 la sembianza non süa in che disparve,
query.result:
91 Then, like people who have been under masks, 92 who seem different from before, if they remove 93 the appearance that was not theirs and in which they disappeared,
(Note: "süa" is an archaic form of "sua", meaning "his/her/its".)

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 così mi si cambiaro in maggior feste 95 li fiori e le faville, sì ch’io vidi 96 ambo le corti del ciel manifeste.
query.result: 94 thus the flowers and the sparks changed for me into greater joy, 95 so that I saw 96 both courts of heaven made manifest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 O isplendor di Dio, per cu’ io vidi 98 l’alto trïunfo del regno verace, 99 dammi virtù a dir com’ ïo il vidi!
query.result: 97 O splendor of God, through whom I saw 98 the high triumph of the true kingdom, 99 give me the power to tell how I saw it!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Lume è là sù che visibile face 101 lo creatore a quella creatura 102 che solo in lui vedere ha la sua pace.
query.result: 100 There is a light up there that makes visible 101 the creator to that creature 102 who has its peace only in seeing him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 E’ si distende in circular figura, 104 in tanto che la sua circunferenza 105 sarebbe al sol troppo larga cintura.
query.result: 103 And it extends in a circular figure, 104 so much so that its circumference 105 would be too large a belt for the sun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Fassi di raggio tutta sua parvenza 107 reflesso al sommo del mobile primo, 108 che prende quindi vivere e potenza.
query.result: 106 All its appearance is made of a ray 107 reflected from the summit of the primum mobile, 108 which takes life and power from there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 E come clivo in acqua di suo imo 110 si specchia, quasi per vedersi addorno, 111 quando è nel verde e ne’ fioretti opimo,
query.result: 109 And as a hillside is mirrored in water at its foot, 110 as if to see itself adorned, 111 when it is rich in green and flowers,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 sì, soprastando al lume intorno intorno, 113 vidi specchiarsi in più di mille soglie 114 quanto di noi là sù fatto ha ritorno.
query.result: 112 so, rising above the light all around, 113 I saw mirrored in more than a thousand thresholds 114 all that of us has returned up there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 E se l’infimo grado in sé raccoglie 116 sì grande lume, quanta è la larghezza 117 di questa rosa ne l’estreme foglie!
query.result: 115 And if the lowest level gathers in itself 116 such great light, how great is the breadth 117 of this rose in its outermost petals!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 La vista mia ne l’ampio e ne l’altezza 119 non si smarriva, ma tutto prendeva 120 il quanto e ’l quale di quella allegrezza.
query.result: 118 My sight was not lost in the vastness and the height, 119 but took in all the quantity and quality 120 of that happiness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Presso e lontano, lì, né pon né leva: 122 ché dove Dio sanza mezzo governa, 123 la legge natural nulla rileva.
query.result: 121 Near and far, there, neither adds nor subtracts: 122 for where God governs without intermediary, 123 natural law is of no consequence.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Nel giallo de la rosa sempiterna, 125 che si digrada e dilata e redole 126 odor di lode al sol che sempre verna,
query.result: 124 In the yellow of the sempiternal rose, 125 which fades and expands and exhales 126 an odor of praise to the sun that is always in spring,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 qual è colui che tace e dicer vole, 128 mi trasse Bëatrice, e disse: «Mira 129 quanto è ’l convento de le bianche stole!
query.result: 127 like one who is silent and wants to speak, 128 Beatrice drew me to her and said: "Look 129 how great is the assembly of the white robes!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Vedi nostra città quant’ ella gira; 131 vedi li nostri scanni sì ripieni, 132 che poca gente più ci si disira.

Please translate each line literally into English.
133 E ’n quel gran seggio a che tu li occhi tieni 134 per la corona che già v’è sù posta, 135 prima che tu a queste nozze ceni,

query.result: 136 will sit the soul, which will be august below, 137 of the lofty Henry, who will come to set Italy straight 138 before she is ready.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 La cieca cupidigia che v’ammalia 140 simili fatti v’ha al fantolino 141 che muor per fame e caccia via la balia.
query.result: 139 The blind greed that bewitches you 140 has made you similar to the little child 141 who is dying of hunger and pushes away the nurse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 142 And such a one will then be prefect in the divine court, 143 that neither openly nor secretly 144 will anyone walk with him on the same path.
